name: Holiday Inn Express Doncaster

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights while visiting relatives in the area. The hotel is near the industrial estate and not far off the motorway and outlet shops. The check in was very quick and the staff were polite and friendly. The hotel looks fairly new and has a big car park. The rooms were big with good sized bathrooms and amenities and very comfortable. There was free internet access in the reception area. The rooms were very quiet with virtually no noise overnight. Breakfast was very good with a selection of both hot and cold food. Quick check out - no complaints at all and would recommend for anyone visiting the area. The restaurant/pub across the car park from the hotel had excellent meals and would recommend this as well.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Doncaster

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night with young family travelling on holiday to Scotland. Booked online and a grat price of £39.95 for a family room including breakfast. Hotel has a good location for motorway access, check in was speedy with no problems. Room as expected, clean, tidy and well equipped. Breakfast area well supplied with both hot and cold food. Check out was also swift and efficient. This is a very good hotel which is fairly new and kept to a high standard. Will use again if in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night travelling home to Scotland. Good location for motorway access.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Speedy check in with no problems. Room as expected, clean, tidy and well equipped.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Good Location

reviews.text: Breakfast area well supplied with food stuff, both hot and cold.
reviews.title: Clean, functional and good value hotel

reviews.text: Excellent value for money, very helpful staff. Clean and tidy. Extremely happy with overall stay. Thank you
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: a bit pissed off as they couldnt locate my resavation and had to spend hours at the reception with children, though we would consider going back again
reviews.title: very nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice quiet location, with new Retail park being created nearby. (Great Car boot on Sundays!). When I walked in I had the impression that the hotel had only just opened it was so fresh and clean. Was shocked it had been open 3 years. Congratulations to staff. Great Reception, room was great, bedding superb. One very small complaint, during the night without your glasses it is impossible to read the time on the TV digital clock. Something nearer the beds would be good. New 'hot' breakfast good, 2 items sausages and beans, but plenty on the 'cold' side. Altogether a nice hotel. Would have been nice if Wi Fi had been included. Some HIE include others don't so just pot luck I suppose. I would recomend this hotel. Nice quiet surroundings.
reviews.title: Feels new, it is clean and fresh and quiet

reviews.text: Nice clean Hotel , typical HIE so no complaints with accomadation and service, Points to note , as the Hotel is new its does come up on Sat Nav, so make sure you have directions with you, rather than rely on your Sat Nav, what do we do before them !!. One other slightly annoying was that I could not get any siganal on my mobile broadband, which we would expect in a City, not the Hotels fault I am sure, but at £10 for internet connection I think this is a bit much, thus making a cheap overnight stay, not so cheap !
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
New and Shiney
reviews.text: Apart from that, the Hotel is great.
My wife & I stayed at this hotel with our son and his family, after he had made an prepaid advance booking for 2 rooms @ £40 per room including breakfast.
reviews.title: Couldn't believe how good this was for the price!

reviews.text: We've stayed at quite a few Travelodges/ Premier Inns, but this was a superior experience. The place was modern and had been carefully planned and thought out, so we couldn't find anything to pick fault with. We were especially impressed with the shower room where the front door opened to become the toilet door and the shower was a modern thermostatically controlled unit. What's more it was supplied with a flannel- how often do you get one of those these days?
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, convenient

reviews.text: The room was a fairly standard layout for budget hotels, but was tastefully fitted out with everything we needed (including an ingenious kettle and tea making stand). The room was air-conditioned (with a very quiet fan) and the bed was one of the most comfortable we've slept in at a budget hotel (Lenny Henry, eat your heart out)!
reviews.title: Clean, basic and noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of that, the room charge included a complimentary breakfast, which was a nice continental one supplemented by a buffet style egg, sausage and beans cooked food. It may not have been up to the standard of expensive hotels, but for what we paid, it was great.
reviews.title: Great holiday for day and night at races !

reviews.text: All told, we'd happily go there again.
reviews.title: Functional, good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at hotel on a saturday evening and well greeted and looked after by the receptionist. In our spotlessly clean room in minutes. Back to reception and a swift half while waiting for our taxi they had kindly phoned for us. About two miles away for £5. As many people have mentioned, we had a little problem finding it. I used my Sat Nav which leaves you on the main road. Probably should of used the wriiten details from the hotel site directing you from the motorway. If you end up outside the Doncaster football stadium, which we did, you are not too far away. I know it's on a retail park, but you do get a nice quiet comfortable night and lovely breakfast in the morning. Overall , spotless, friendly staff and excellent value. Loads of good real ale in Doncaster, so will be looking for an excuse to go back soon.
reviews.title: Worth finding, if you can!

reviews.text: Not the cheapest Hi Express, but you do get what you pay for, a very clean well appointed hotel. First impressions were "strange, in an industrial estate" but with Hotel serving food and a brewers fayre style resturant 100yds away, hey ho.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine for what I booked for, business meeting

reviews.text: I used the grand room for business meeting, ideal, very comfortable and good coffee.
reviews.title: good value for money excellent staff

reviews.text: Will certainly use this Hotel again
reviews.title: A very good hotel, if somewhat difficult to find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very good express with excellent helpful staff also offers evening meals which is a bonus tho i arrived too late room standard express but clean modern and excellent interactive tv overall a very positive experience
reviews.title: Good stopover close to A1M

description: Express by Holiday Inn Doncaster has been created for value and comfort. The hotel is Fully Air Conditioned ,every room is equipped with all the facilities you need for a relaxing and comfortable stay, an invigorating power shower, satellite TV, in-room movies, broadband access, High Speed Internet Access and tea/coffee making facilities. Guests can enjoy our complimentary continental buffet breakfast and relax in the Great Room lounge and bar area. FREE WIFI in lounge and bar. Located in First Point Business Park, just a two minute drive from the M18, this hotel is the perfect choice for leisure and business. In house are 2 fully equipped meeting rooms. The Dome Leisure Centre. and the Keepmoat Stadium home of Doncaster Rovers Football Team are both less than 5 minutes drive away. The Doncaster Racecourse and Exhibition Centre home of the famous St. Leger Race is local. Doncaster is also home to Doncaster Knights Rugby Club at Castle Park.The hotel is situated close to Robin Hood Airport and the location of the hotel offers excellent transport links to the M18 and A1(M) for nearby cities such as Sheffield, Leeds and Manchester.
